abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Small and Medium
            Enterprise Capacity Building and Economic Governance Project
            for Cabo Verde were as follows: outcomes was moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was low, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            To encourage take-up of matching grants programs, conduct a
            communications campaign with accessible messaging and means
            of communication for Small and Medium Enterprises (SME) and
            ensure that eligibility criteria are inclusive. The
            implementing agency of a matching grants program is well
            positioned to gather key data directly from beneficiaries on
            the program’s impact. Public procurement is an area of
            potential joint (Tribunal das Contas, TdC ) Court of
            Auditors and governance support, beset with opportunities to
            positively impact SMEs’ market reach. Use caution when
            including macroeconomic indicators for a project that
            supports limited microeconomic reforms. Attribution will be
            extremely difficult. Establish the implementation unit by
            the time of effectiveness. Prioritize impact studies of
            innovative interventions. Conduct operational training for
            all Project Coordination Unit (PCU) and implementing agency
            staff involved in project implementation, even if they
            already have experience with World Bank projects.
